Description: Glazed steatite scarab (Hall, 1913: Type M2), elytra marked and humeral callosities present, double suture, exaggerated and feathered legs, pierced longitudinally, base inscribed with a cartouche, containing the prenomen of Thutmose III, flanked by standing and kneeling figures, with three Bes figures below, and three kneeling figures beneath.
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): p.54
